meanings.definition: The act of forming a concept or idea.
meanings.sent1: Her conceptualization of the story helped her understand it better.
meanings.sent2: The conceptualization of a new product requires creativity and planning.
meanings.sent3: His conceptualization of a talking dog made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The artist's conceptualization of emotions as colors was truly inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's conceptualization of math using shapes made it easier to grasp.

meanings.sent1: Deep conceptualization is needed to solve complex problems.
meanings.sent2: The conceptualization of philosophical ideas can be challenging.
meanings.sent3: Their conceptualization of time as a rubber band was amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her conceptualization of freedom as a bird soaring high was beautiful.
meanings.sent5: The conceptualization of space as a vast ocean is quite intriguing.

meanings.definition: The representation of abstract ideas or concepts.
meanings.sent1: The artist's conceptualization of love was displayed in the painting.
meanings.sent2: Visual conceptualization helps in understanding complex theories.
meanings.sent3: Their conceptualization of happiness as a fluffy cloud was amusing.
meanings.sent4: The conceptualization of success as a mountain to climb motivates many.
meanings.sent5: The conceptualization of justice as a balancing scale is powerful.
